AsciiArtHelper
This class provides helper methods for handling ASCII art related to objective cards.

The Boards class is a singleton that manages the game boards and chat messages.

Class for the representation of other players the boards.
boardsListener
The boardsListener class implements the Listener interface.

Card
The Card class represents a generic card in the game.

The class Location is used to represent the location of a card in the grid.

The Chat class manages the chat functionality in the game.

This class represents the view of the chat in the game.

ClientHandler
The ClientHandler interface defines the methods for handling client-side operations.
ClientInterface
 
ClientMain
The ClientMain class is the entry point of the client application.
ClientSocket
 
ClientToServer
 
ClientView
The ClientView class is an abstract class that defines the methods for updating the client view.
Command
The Command class is an abstract class that represents a command in the game.
CommandGlobalChat
The CommandGlobalChat class represents a command to open the global chat.
CommandHandler
The CommandHandler class is responsible for handling the execution of commands in the game.
CommandPlayCard
The CommandPlayCard class represents a command to play a card in the game.
CommandPrivateChat
The CommandPrivateChat class represents a command to initiate a private chat.
CommandShowCardLegend
The CommandShowCardLegend class represents a command to show the card legend in the game.
CommandShowCommonGoal
The CommandShowCommonGoal class represents a command to show the common goal of the game.
CommandShowHandCard
The CommandShowHandCard class represents a command to show the hand cards of a player.
CommandShowPersonalGoal
The CommandShowPersonalGoal class represents a command to show the personal goal of a player.
ConnectionType
Enumeration of the connection types available in the game (RMI and TCP).
CoveredAngleGoldCard
Class to manage the Covered Angle Gold Card in the game* IDEA: 1) for each card played by the player (x,y), check if the location around that card are empty: |x-1,y| |x,y-1| |x,y| |x,y+1| |x+1,y| 2) if the location checked is empty, count how many corners are covered by placing a card in that location, using the function countCoveredCorners() on that location 3) After repeated the process for all the played cards, we know for each possible next card available location and how many corners are covered by placing a card in that location in a dictionary: {location: coveredCorners}
Deck
The Deck class represents the deck of cards in the game and manages the drawing of cards.
DiagonalObjectiveCard
Class of the diagonal objective card, 3 the cards of the same color in a diagonal pattern give points to the player
DrawCard
 
End
The End class is a singleton that manages the end of the game.

endListener
The endListener class implements the Listener interface.

The RMIClient class is the client-side implementation of the RMI connection.

The RMIController class manages the RMI connection between the server and the client.

RMI Server class that manages the connection between the server and the client through the RMI protocol.

Server
The Server class is responsible for managing the server-side of the client-server architecture.
ServerHandler
This class handles the server-side logic for a client connection.
ServerInterface
The ServerInterface extends the Remote interface and provides methods for remote invocation from another Java virtual machine.
ServerMain
The ServerMain class is the entry point of the server application.

This class represents the starting GUI of the application.
